alert.note: Alert for Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 11:19AM EDT until March 27 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...For the following counties, in Central Ohio, Hocking and Pickaway. In South Central Ohio, Highland, Pike and Ross. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Logan, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Nelsonville, Lynchburg, Leesburg, Kingston, Marshall, Sardinia, Bainbridge, North Folk Village, Cynthiana, Highland Holiday, Rocky Fork Point, Belfast, Hocking Hills State Park, Russell, New Market and Starr.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
